CommonFields.Title: Epoxy-based nanocomposites for electrical energy storage. I: Effects of montmorillonite and barium titanate nanofillers
Author: Tomer, V.
Polizos, G.
Manias, E.
Randall, C. A.

Filler.Description: For the inorganic oMMT and BT phases, comercial available materials were used: Nanomer I30E MMT (Nancor, IL) with cation exchange capacity of about 1.4 meq/g and an organic loading of octadecyl-ammonium surfactant of about 30 wt%

Mixing.Description: The composites were prepared by adding the fillers to epoxy resin.  The dispersion of the particles was aided by high shear mixing and sonication of the suspensions.

Heating.Description: The suspensions were charged with appropriate amounts of crosslinker, 2-ethyl-4-methylimidazole, and were degassed under vacuum to remove any trapped air.

Transmission_Electron_Microscopy.Description: A Leica Ultracut UCT Microtome with cryoattachment was used for sectioning the specimines.  The microtomed samples were tested under a transmission electron microscope (TEM, Jeol JEM-2010 with LaB6 emitter) operated at an accelerating voltage of 200 kV

Dynamic_Mechanical_Analysis.Description: DMA measurements were carried out on a TA Q800 instrument.  Samples stripes (15 mm in length, 6 mm in width, and 200 um thick) were measured in the tensile mode at a frequency of 1 Hz.  The temperature ramps were performed under 1 MPa stress and at a 4 deg C per minute heating rate.

Dielectric_and_Impedance_Spectroscopy_An.Equipment: Novocontrol ZGS Alpha connected to a Novocontrol Quatro Cryosystem
Dielectric_and_Impedance_Spectroscopy_An.Description: DRS experiments were performed over broad frequency (10^-2 to 10^6 Hz) and temperature (180 to 100 deg C) ranges.  Prior to DRS measurements, the samples were equilibrated in the cell at 100 deg C for 30 min.

Differential_Scanning_Calorimetry.Equipment: TA Q200 calorimeter in a gas mixture of nitrogen and helium
Differential_Scanning_Calorimetry.Description: DSC data were collected on a TA Q200 calorimeter in a gas mixture of nitrogen and helium.  The measured heat flow was obtained at a cooling temperature ramp of 5 deg C per min.  The temp accuracy was 0.1 deg C.

Thermogravimetric_Analysis.Description: TGA measurements were performed on a Thermal Analysis Instruments SDT Q600 analyzer under nitrogen environment.  The temperature ramps were from 20 to 1000 deg C at a heating rate of 10 deg C per min.
